definitions.definition: To regress; to slip backwards or revert to a previous, worse state.
definitions.example: He felt better for a little while, before his condition started to backslide.

definitions.definition: To shirk responsibility; to renege on one's obligations or commitments.
definitions.example: Rich countries are backsliding on their commitment to agree to new WTO measures to help people in poor countries gain access to affordable medicines. â€” Oxfam press release, 24 June 2002

definitions.definition: An occasion on which one backslides, especially in a moral sense
